Package com.microfocus.adm.pulse.pluginapi.chain

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    PulseAlertWriter
    Provides a means for a PulseChainStepPlugin to report messages in the activity feed within Pulse.
    PulseAlertWriterAware
    Implement to receive the PulseAlertWriter instance to use to report alerts to the Pulse activity feed.
    PulseChainAbortMonitor
    Allows a PulseChainStepPlugin to check to see if the chain has been aborted and allow it to stop processing the step.
    PulseChainAbortMonitorAware
    Implement to receive the PulseChainAbortMonitor instance to use to detect when a chain step plugin should prematurely stop processing the current step because the user has asked for the chain to stop.
    PulseChainStepConfigAware<CONFIG_TYPE>
    If a PulseChainStepPlugin needs configuration from the step it can use this interface to receive the configuration as a Java POJO.
    PulseChainStepPlugin
    Every chain step plugin implemented in Java must provide an implementation of this interface which is used to ask the plugin to inspect one or more changesets.
    PulseConsoleLogger
    Allows logging at different logging levels.
    PulseConsoleLoggerAware
    Allow a plugin to access the console log for the chain run.
    PulseEmailBuilder
    Used to create emails that will be sent using PulseEmailReporter.
    PulseEmailReporter
    The email reporter allows experts to report email messages.
    PulseEmailReporterAware
    Implement to receive the PulseEmailReporter instance to use to create emails and ask for them to be sent.
    PulseEnvironmentVariableAware
    Provides access to the user supplied environment variables for this run of the plugin.
    PulseFindingBuilder
    Used to create findings that will be recorded using PulseFindingReporter.
    PulseFindingReporter
    The findings reporter is used by the experts to annotate the files that have changed.
    PulseFindingReporterAware
    Implement to receive the PulseFindingReporter instance to use to report findings to Pulse.
    PulseMeasurementBuilder
    Builder used to create measurements of previously registered metrics.
    PulseMeasurementReporter
    The measurement reporter is used by the experts to record measurements of the experts metrics.
    PulseMeasurementReporterAware
    Implement to receive the PulseMeasurementReporter instance to use to report measurements of metrics to Pulse.
    PulseMetricBuilder
    Builder is used to create a metric definition to be registered via PulseMetricRegistrar.registerMetric(PulseMetric).
    PulseMetricRegistrar
    The metrics registrar is used by the experts to register metrics.
    PulseMetricRegistrarAware
    Implement to receive the PulseMetricRegistrar instance to use to report metrics to Pulse and find definitions previously registered.
    PulsePersistentDirectoryAware
    Provides the plugin with a directory it can persist data into between runs.
    PulseReportFileReporter
    The report file reporter is used by the experts to record a report file they want to make available to Dimensions Pulse.
    PulseReportFileReporterAware
    Implement to receive the PulseReportFileReporter instance to use to report a file to Pulse for the current step.
    PulseRepositoryContextAware  
    PulseTemporaryDirectoryAware  
    PulseUrlReporter
    The URL reporter is used by the experts to report a URL they want to make available to Dimensions Pulse.
    PulseUrlReporterAware
    Implement to receive the PulseUrlReporter instance to use to report a URL to Pulse for the current step.
    PulseVariableTokenizer
    Allows a string to have variable tokens replaced.
    PulseVariableTokenizerAware
    Allows the Plugin to receive the tokenizer that can be used to retrieve variables from Pulse.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    PulseChainPluginApiException  
    PulseChainStepPluginException
    General exception that can be thrown by an expert or the Pulse plugin framework when an exception has occurred.
    PulseMetricNotFoundException  
    PulseMetricNotRegisteredException
    Thrown if a metric could not be registered.
